intro: Origanum bilgeri, commonly known as Turkish oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple. Its leaves are rich in essential oils, contributing to its distinctive fragrance and medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for both culinary and ornamental use.
